title: Validator should print more information about the read wallet/accounts
body:
# ðŸš€ Feature Request

### Description

Referring to #5450

After startup Validator should display information about the wallet and/or accounts it read from the wallet, independent from the deposit status.
Right now Validator just sits there, waiting to connect to Beacon-Chain or waiting for it to sync to the chain head before you get any information about your validator accounts. 

This becomes more obvious pre-genesis:
```
time="2020-09-23 07:44:20" level=warning msg="Running Node on Spadina Testnet" prefix=flags
time="2020-09-23 07:44:21" level=info msg="Checking DB" databasePath="/data/wallet/derived" prefix=node
time="2020-09-23 07:44:21" level=info msg="Starting validator node" prefix=node version="Prysm/v1.0.0-alpha.26/1ce7cd5f50134e6cd272f47b302e53723c43d1e3. Built at: 2020-09-23 07:35:06+00:00"
time="2020-09-23 07:44:21" level=info msg="Starting gRPC gateway" address="127.0.0.1:7500" prefix=gateway
time="2020-09-23 07:44:21" level=info msg="gRPC server listening on address" address="127.0.0.1:7000" prefix=rpc
time="2020-09-23 07:44:21" level=warning msg="You are using an insecure gRPC connection. If you are running your beacon node and validator on the same machines, you can ignore this message. If you want to know how to enable secure connections, see: https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/secure-grpc" prefix=validator
time="2020-09-23 07:44:21" level=info msg="Waiting for beacon chain start log from the ETH 1.0 deposit contract" prefix=validator
```

With the given output I have no idea if it was even able to read all the keys I have in my wallet. Or if it even tried to decode the wallet.

### Describe the solution you'd like

At startup it should print out information about the given wallet and/or accounts, like
```
Decoded [HD|Non-HD|...] wallet: /data/wallet
Read validator key 0 publicKey=...
```
